instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sleep mode when plugged in
threads.message:
Hey folks,

I have a weird problem with an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board. When I plug in the MagSafe the backlight and LCD go out (I am guessing it goes in sleep mode). Unplug the charger and it’s back up. Also good to note that there is no light on the MagSafe.

I have tried a new I/o board and connecting flex.

Can someone help me with which lines I can start checking?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sleep mode when plugged in
threads.message:
Check first <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signal in both cases.
Inspect J9500 pin solders.
The audio and left USB port work?

The board turns on with charger alone (without battery)?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sleep mode when plugged in
threads.message:
Turns on with battery but as soon as you plug in the charger the screen goes blank but fans keep spinning. When I unplug the charger the screen comes back on.

If I leave the dc in connector plugged in but disconnect the I/0 connector flex then we don’t get the problem and will get lightning bolt on the system.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sleep mode when plugged in
threads.message: I will check you suggestions tomorrow and get back to you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sleep mode when plugged in
threads.message:
Okay so 

<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is

4.5v DC-IN board connected
2.5 with DC-IN board connected
pulsing with charger plugged in


confirmed backlight is going out with charger connected.

changed smc lid pull up resistor but same problem. 

3v4 G3H remains constant (Good)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sleep mode when plugged in
threads.message:
I'm wondering how do you get 4.5V into 3V42 signal line.
BTW, in which scenario do you get 2.5V???

"Inspect J9500 pin solders."

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sleep mode when plugged in
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> doesn't make its way to the DC-in board, usually caused by bad FFC or J9500 indeed…
